SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.graphics

Class LinearColor

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Color
civitas.celestis.graphics.LinearColor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Paint, Transparency, Serializable
public class LinearColor extends Color
An 8-bit RGBA color with linear transition capabilities.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • LinearColor

      public LinearColor(@Nonnull String rgb24)
      Creates a new linear color. The 24-bit RGB representation is also known as the hex code. The format should be either "RRGGBB" or "#RRGGBB".
      Parameters:
      rgb24 - The 24-bit RGB representation of this color

    • LinearColor

      public LinearColor(int argb32)
      Creates a new linear color.
      Parameters:
      argb32 - The 32-bit ARGB representation of this color

    • LinearColor

      public LinearColor(int r, int g, int b)
      Creates a new linear color. All components must respect the range of [0, 255]. The alpha component will be populated with 255. (opaque)
      Parameters:
      r - The red component of this color
      g - The green component of this color
      b - The blue component of this color

    • LinearColor

      public LinearColor(int r, int g, int b, int a)
      Creates a new linear color. All components must respect the range of [0, 255].
      Parameters:
      r - The red component of this color
      g - The green component of this color
      b - The blue component of this color
      a - The alpha component of this color

    • LinearColor

      public LinearColor(@Nonnull Color c)
      Creates a new linear color.
      Parameters:
      c - The color of which to copy component values from

    • LinearColor

      public LinearColor(@Nonnull Tuple<? extends Number> t)
      Creates a new linear color. All components must respect the range of [0, 255].
      Parameters:
      t - A tuple containing the components of this color in RGBA order

    • LinearColor

      public LinearColor(@Nonnull Vector4 v)
      Creates a new linear color. All components must respect the range of [0, 255].
      Parameters:
      v - A vector containing the components of this color in RGBA order

  • Method Details

    • argb32

      public int argb32()
      Returns the 32-bit ARGB representation of this color.
      Returns:
      The 32-bit ARGB representation of this color

    • lerp

      @Nonnull public LinearColor lerp(@Nonnull Color c, double t)
      Linearly interpolates (LERP) between this color and the provided color c, according to the provided interpolation parameter t. This method differs from Colors.lerp(Color, Color, double) in that the interpolation parameter is not forcefully clamped to be within the acceptable range.
      Parameters:
      c - The color of which to interpolate towards
      t - The interpolation parameter
      Returns:
      The interpolated color
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the interpolation will result in at least one of the RGBA components to be outside the range of [0, 255]
